content: happily ever after mitts a free design by susan b anderson ™ ™ www spudandchloe com sweet yarns for real life ™ gauge 7 stitches per inch in stockinette stitch note you can easily make these longer or shorter to suit your needs and you can try them on as you go to help figure out the length that s best for you materials scissors yarn needle right and left mitts are made exactly the same pattern with shitake cast and starting at the arm end of the mitt cast on 54 stitches placing 18 stitches on each of 3 double pointed needles join to work in the round being careful not to twist the stitches place a stitch marker on the first stitch edging stripe rnds 1-4 k2 p1 repeat to the end of the round rnds 5-8 knit arm stripes switch to dachshund leaving shitake attached size rnds 1-4 knit to fit an average older child to woman s hands/arms at this point wrap shitake around the working strand of dachshund to carry up as you work continue to do this in order to carry the measurements yarn on the shitake/dachshund stripes for the color not being used 13 5 inches in length 7 7 inches in circumference at that time rnds 5-8 knit yarn switch to shitake spud & chloë fine 80% superwash wool 20% silk 248 rnds 9-16 knit yards/65 grams 1 skein each in shitake #7814 dachshunk repeat the dachshund and shitake stripes until you have 8 stripes #7803 popcorn #7800 tutu #7807 sassafras #7808 cricket total see photo including the edging stripe this section is the place #7804 and calypso #7806 to shorten or add length if so desired or 1 skein of fine will make a complete pair of mitts in one color mitts only one color after the edging stripe or rounds 1 8 knit every round until the arm measures 7 5 inches from the cast on edge or 2 skeins of fine in two shades to stripe will make 2 pairs of mitts colorful stripes note for the following colorful stripes cut the ends as you change needles colors to weave in later us size 3 double pointed needles or size to obtain gauge © 2012 this
